content.body: Hmm, the `location.hostname` setter is still kinda bogus. E.g., set it to `^` and it throws in most implementations. But what argues for that?
content.formatted_body: Hmm, the location.hostname setter is still kinda bogus. E.g., set it to ^ and it throws in most implementations. But what argues for that?

content.body: (I'm still trying to unravel `URLPattern` nonsense. But turns out there's non-`URLPattern` nonsense too.)
content.formatted_body: (I'm still trying to unravel URLPattern nonsense. But turns out there's non-URLPattern nonsense too.)

content.body: Is it supposed to be legal to reject and resolve promises while "in parallel"? Or should spec authors wrap those in "queue a task on the such and such task source given such and such global object to resolve/reject `promise` with XYZ"
Oh I asked this and then realized that the latest WebCrypto spec has a "when we say throw, we mean queue a task to resolve the promise with" in the latest draft and our implementation is wrong ðŸ˜…

but then there's this from `extract a body` in Fetch https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-bodyinit-extract, that says to create a Uint8Array while "in parallel", which seems unfortunate. I thought that "in parallel" was supposed to only operate on realm-independent WebIDL objects. 
> 12. If action is non-null, then run these steps in parallel:
>   1. Run action.
>   2. Whenever one or more bytes are available and stream is not errored, enqueue the result of creating a Uint8Array from the available bytes into stream.
>   3. When running action is done, close stream.
content.formatted_body:
but then there's this from extract a body in Fetch https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-bodyinit-extract, that says to create a Uint8Array while "in parallel", which seems unfortunate. I thought that "in parallel" was supposed to only operate on realm-independent WebIDL objects.

  1. If action is non-null, then run these steps in parallel:
  2. Run action.
  3. Whenever one or more bytes are available and stream is not errored, enqueue the result of creating a Uint8Array from the available bytes into stream.
  4. When running action is done, close stream.

content.body:
* but then there's this from `extract a body` in Fetch https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-bodyinit-extract, that says to create a Uint8Array while "in parallel", which seems unfortunate. I thought that "in parallel" was supposed to only operate on realm-independent WebIDL objects.

> 12. If action is non-null, then run these steps in parallel:
>     1. Run action.
>     2. Whenever one or more bytes are available and stream is not errored, enqueue the result of creating a Uint8Array from the available bytes into stream.
>     3. When running action is done, close stream.
content.formatted_body:
*

but then there's this from extract a body in Fetch https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-bodyinit-extract, that says to create a Uint8Array while "in parallel", which seems unfortunate. I thought that "in parallel" was supposed to only operate on realm-independent WebIDL objects.

  1. If action is non-null, then run these steps in parallel:
    1. Run action.
    2. Whenever one or more bytes are available and stream is not errored, enqueue the result of creating a Uint8Array from the available bytes into stream.
    3. When running action is done, close stream.

but then there's this from `extract a body` in Fetch https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-bodyinit-extract, that says to create a Uint8Array while "in parallel", which seems unfortunate. I thought that "in parallel" was supposed to only operate on realm-independent WebIDL objects.

> 12. If action is non-null, then run these steps in parallel:

m.new_content.formatted_body:
but then there's this from extract a body in Fetch https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-bodyinit-extract, that says to create a Uint8Array while "in parallel", which seems unfortunate. I thought that "in parallel" was supposed to only operate on realm-independent WebIDL objects.

  1. If action is non-null, then run these steps in parallel:
    1. Run action.
    2. Whenever one or more bytes are available and stream is not errored, enqueue the result of creating a Uint8Array from the available bytes into stream.
    3. When running action is done, close stream.
